s.text: The WP lead reports that at a Thursday news conference Japanese Prime Minister Hashimoto appeared delighted with the success of that U.S.-Japan yen buy and pledged himself ready to "do my best to help write off bad loans, achieve growth driven by domestic demand, open Japanese markets further and promote deregulation."

The WP lead reports that at a Thursday news conference Japanese Prime Minister Hashimoto appeared delighted with the success of that U.S.-Japan yen buy and pledged himself ready to "do my best to help write off bad loans, achieve growth driven by domestic demand, open Japanese markets further and promote deregulation."

Question: Do such worries have anything to do with the fact that although both stories mention the recently outed white male Stephen Glass, neither mentions black female Janet Cooke, the WP fabricator who cost her paper a Pulitzer?
John McCain thinks being vilified in that ad campaign may have helped his White House chances.
